properties.headline: Mardi Gras Parade - Saturday 29 February - SYDNEY CBD TO MOORE PARK via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde
properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops from 4.30pm while major roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of spectators will gather to see the annual Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park South to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until 11.30pm approx. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 3pm and most roads remain closed until 4am Sunday.

ROAD CLOSURES

From 3pm: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St, Yurong Pkwy and sections of Campbell St and surrounding local roads in Surry Hills will close.

From 4.30pm: Oxford St from College St to Darlinghurst Rd, College St from William St to Oxford St, Flinders St from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd and Anzac Pde southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open). Sections of Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St, Crown St, Bourke St and various local roads off Oxford St will also close.

From 4.15pm College St southbound at St Mary's Rd will close, but will reopen by 6.30pm, while all other roads remain closed until 4am. 

From 6pm: sections of South Dowling will be closed between Oxford St and Fiztroy St

From 6:30pm: Anzac Pde northbound from Lang Rd to Fitzroy St including the Eastern Distributor Anzac Pde on-ramp, sections of Moore Park Rd at Flinders St and Driver Ave will close.

From 9pm to 1am: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market and Goulburn streets will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD. 

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and to expect expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Pedestrian access across the parade route will be maintained at Riley St, Crown St and Albion St from 4.30pm to 7pm, after such time there is no pedestrian crossing of Oxford or Flinders Streets available until roads reopen. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 6am on Saturday until 4am on Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Surry Hills and Moore Park. Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde

properties.headline: !Disregard But Do Not Delete! - BROKEN HILL Blende Street
Triathlon - Sunday 16 February - WOY WOY McMasters Rd at Blackwell Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people will take part in the Woy Woy Kids TRY-athlon held at various Woy Woy venues including the Peninsula Leisure Centre, James Browne Oval and local roads from 9am until 12pm midday.

Road closures will be in place from 7am until 1pm on McMasters Rd between Blackwall Rd and Ocean Beach Rd and on Welcome St between McMasters Rd and Alpha St. Local detours will be in place. Access to McMasters Rd at Blackwall Rd will also be restricted. 

Motorists should allow additional travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

properties.headline: Concerts - Saturday 15 February - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd approaching ANZ Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Extra services will run, tickets to Queen include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 70,000 concert goers will be attending the Queen & Adam Lambert show at ANZ Stadium gates open from 6.30pm and the Alice Cooper concert at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena from 7.30pm in Olympic Park on Saturday night.

Traffic will be heavy on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Epping Rd, Centenary Dr, Ryde Rd and Silverwater Rd approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time.

Roads within Olympic Park start closing from as early as midday on Sat 15 Feb, with some roads remaining closed until 2am on Mon 17 Feb, including sections of Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Grand Pde, Murray Rose Ave, Dawn Fraser Ave, Herb Elliott Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Edwin Flack Ave and nearby roads. See the Olympic Park interactive map for details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.headline: Fun Run - Saturday 16 February - RHODES TO OLYMPIC PARK Bennelong Bridge at Hill Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses in Olympic Park will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,000 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run from 7:15am to 10am.

Bennelong Bridge from Shoreline Dr and Waterways St will be closed from 5am to 10am along with sections of Waterways St, Wentworth St, Wentworth Pl and Shoreline Dr.

Sections of Hill Rd, Kevin Coombs Ave and the Holker Busway will close from 5am until 9am. Lane closures will be in place from 5am until 10am on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St. 

Detours around the closures will be via the P5 Loop Rd. Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, be aware of changed traffic conditions and increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:

arrangementElements.title: Road closures

properties.headline: Expo - Friday 7 to Sunday 9 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd, Chatham Rd approaching Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 2020 Caravan and Camping Expo at Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre in Broadmeadow from 9am to 5pm on Friday and Saturday, and 9am to 4pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

properties.headline: Street Festival - Saturday 8 February - WYONG Alison Rd and local roads at Pacific Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Love Lanes Festival at the Chapman Building in Wyong from 4pm to 9pm.

Local roads will close between 6am and 11pm including Robleys Ln, Alison Rd, Hely St, Bakers Ln, Peters Ln and Rankens Circuit. There will be no access to Alison Rd, Bakers Ln and Robleys Ln from the Pacific Hwy during this time. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along the Pacific Hwy through Wyong while road closures are in place.

properties.headline: Mardi Gras Fair Day - Sunday 16 February - CAMPERDOWN City Road and Broadway near Victoria Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Special Event Clearway Map - Mardi Gras Fair Day Sun 16 Feb
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Special Event Clearway Map - Mardi Gras Fair Day Sun 16 Feb

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 70,000 people are expected to attend the annual Mardi Gras Fair Day at Victoria Park from 10am to 9pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual along City Rd, Broadway and Parramatta Rd. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the park and at key pedestrian crossings.

Special event clearways will be in place around the park from 5am to 9:30pm on sections of City Rd and Parramatta Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
CAMPERDOWN

FROM 5AM TO 9.30PM

  • City Road between Carillon Avenue and Parramatta Rd (western side)
  • City Road between Cleveland Street and Butlin Avenue (eastern side)
  • Parramatta Rd between City Road and University Avenue (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.displayName: Mardi Gras Fair Day - Sunday 16 February

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 8 February - KOGARAH Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St at Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 5pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as large crowds travel to and from the Sydney Derby. 

Road closures will be in place before the game on the following roads around the stadium:

- Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St

- English St between the Princes Hwy and High St

- Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 15 February - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Newcastle Jets at Bankwest Stadium from 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Music Festival - Saturday 15 February - POKOLBIN McDonalds Rd at Broke Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the sold-out Red Hot Summer Tour at the Roche Estate in the Hunter Valley from 1pm until 9:30pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Fans using the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr and then either McDonalds Rd or Broke Rd to access the event.

webLinks.linkText: Lunar New Year Twilight Parade - Chatswood

properties.headline: Street Parade - Saturday 8 February - CHATSWOOD Victoria Ave, Endeavour St and Bertram St
properties.publicTransport: Buses to and from Chatswood Interchange will be diverting and missing stops on Victoria Ave from 5:30pm until 8:30pm. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Twilight Parade in Chatswood CBD from 6:30pm until 7:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on Boundary St, Pacific Hwy, Mowbray Rd, Penshurst St, Archer St, Victoria Ave and Albert Ave approaching Chatswood. Motorists should allow plenty of additional travel time.

Road closures will be in place from 5:30pm until 8:30pm to accommodate the event: 

  • Victoria Ave between Anderson St and Neridah St
  • Anderson St between Help St and Albert Ave
  • Bertram St between Victoria Ave and Albert Ave
  • Archer St between Ferguson Lane and Albert Ave
  • Endeavour St
  • Charlotte Ln
  • Orchard Rd

No entry or exit from the Westfield car park on Anderson St during the closure period. Access to the Westfield car park remains available via Albert Ave and Victor St.

Chatswood Chase car park access via Malvern Ave and Neridah St is unaffected however delays are expected.

roads.mainStreet: Victoria Ave, Endeavour St and Bertram St

properties.headline: Triathlon - Saturday 8 February - JINDABYNE TO CHARLOTTE PASS various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 150 participants along with support vehicles will take part in the Australia Alpine Ascent from Jindabyne to Charlotte Pass from 6am until 5pm.

Changed traffic conditions including reduced speed limits and short term closures will be in place along the following roads:

  • Kosciuszko Rd from Kalkite Rd to Alpine Way from 7am until 12pm
  • Alpine Way from Kosciuszko Rd to Dead Horse Gap from 8am until 11:30am
  • Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Summit Rd from 10:30am until 5pm.

Traffic controllers will be on site along the course to assist with the movement of traffic and participants during the event.

Motorists should expect some delays, exercise caution and follow the direction of traffic control.

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way

properties.headline: A-League - Friday 21 February - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Adelaide United at Bankwest Stadium from 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium during Friday evening peak. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Concert - Sunday 16 February - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd approaching ANZ Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Extra services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 70,000 concert goers will be attending the Fire Fight Australia National Bushfire Relief concert at ANZ Stadium in Olympic Park on Sunday night.

Traffic will be heavy on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Epping Rd, Centenary Dr, Ryde Rd and Silverwater Rd approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time.

Roads within Olympic Park start closing from as early as midday on Sat 15 Feb, with some remaining closed until 2am on Mon 17 Feb, including sections of Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Grand Pde, Murray Rose Ave, Dawn Fraser Ave, Herb Elliott Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Edwin Flack Ave and nearby roads. See the Olympic Park interactive map for details.

properties.headline: BBL Cricket Final - Saturday 8 February - MOORE PARK various roads incl Albion St, Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd approaching The SCG
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park walking route and transport map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK CENTRAL PEDESTRIAN BUS ACCESS MAP_18DEC19_V0012 3.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking route and transport map

properties.otherAdvice:
Big Bash League Cricket Final at the SCG: Sydney Sixers v TBC from 7:15pm. Bushfire charity Match from 3:25pm 

Traffic is expected to be heavy as more than 40,000 cricket fans travel to and from Moore Park for the final match.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor southbound, Southern Cross Dr, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed before, during and after the event.

Special event clearways will be in place on various roads around Moore Park from 1pm until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 1PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street 1 between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street 2 between City Road and South Dowling Street (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (both sides)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides) Moore Park
  • More Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Poate Road and Regent Street (southern side - taxis excepted)
  • Moore Park Road between Regent Street and Driver Avenue (southern side - buses excepted)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side) 

Notes: 

  1. From 1pm until 8pm only. 
  2. Existing clearways on Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street are in effect from 6am to 7pm, seven days a week. On event days, these clearways will be extended to the times noted above.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: Music Festival - Sunday 2 February - SYDNEY CBD Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd & Hospital Rd approaching The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the St Jerome's Laneway music festival from 11am to 11pm at the Domain Sydney. 

From 8:30pm to 11:15pm Art Gallery Rd will be closed and from 9:30pm to 11:15pm sections of Mrs Macquaries Rd, St Marys Rd, Prince Albert Rd, Hospital Rd and Cathedral St will be closed.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and use alternative routes while closures are in place.

arrangementElements.html:

FROM 8:30PM TO 11:15PM

FROM 9:30PM TO 11:15PM

  • St Marys Rd from Prince Albert Road to Sir John Young Crescent
  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl (access will be managed for emergency vehicles only)
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd (access will be managed for authorised vehicles only)

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Rugby 7's at Bankwest Stadium on Saturday and Sunday.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time of the final game each night and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: March - Sunday 2 February - SYDNEY CBD various roads incl Liverpool St, Sussex St, Goulburn St, Elizabeth St and William St
properties.publicTransport: Some buses may divert and experience delays. L2 light rail services will be temporarily affected. Check alerts at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place on sections of Liverpool St, Sussex St, Goulburn St, Elizabeth St and William St from 12:45pm until 1:45pm. 

Some roads will progressively re-open as the group travels along the route.

Motorists are advised to avoid the area or expect delays and to follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 2 February - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.publicTransport:
Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Route 55 and 70 buses travelling towards Gosford are diverting away from Donnison St via Showground Rd, Racecourse Rd and Mann St to Gosford Station. Two stops are being missed.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers at Central Coast Stadium from 4pm to 6pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close from 2pm and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.
